channel.title: Dead Code in Loop

item.title: Dead Code in Loop
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You guys both sport the same ideas with looping it, only issue is when its checking the player’s levels.

if (c.playerLevel[c.playerWoodcutting] >= AXE_REQS[axe])

Since “axe” is really an Id, its accessing an index of over 1000, when it needs to be at the max an index of 8.
Would it be more beneficial at this point to use an enum to store the data?

I also tried a 2d array, same issue as before.

Read full topic

item.title: Dead Code in Loop
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

private static boolean goodAxe(final Client c) { for (int axe : VALID_AXE) { if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == axe) { if (c.playerLevel[c.playerWoodcutting] >= AXE_REQS[axe]) return true; else { c.sendMessage("You don't have the required level to cut with this axe!"); return false; } } else { c.sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!"); return false; } } return false; }

Should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Dead Code in Loop
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

for (int axe : VALID_AXE) {
if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == axe) {
//

Seeing this:
VALID_AXE[i]
AXE_REQS[i]

I’d recommend storing the data together

private static final int[][] AXE_DATA = {
 {#ID, #ReqLvl},
 {#ID, #ReqLvl}
};

private static boolean goodAxe(final Client c) {
for (int i = 0; i < AXE_DATA.length; i++) {
if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == AXE_DATA[i][0]) {
                                if (c.playerLevel[c.playerWoodcutting] >= AXE_DATA[i][1]) {
//

item.title: Dead Code in Loop
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Alright, so here’s the deal. When it checks to see if the player has an axe, and if he has the correct level for that axe, it loops through all the axes in the array correct? Well, my problem is its not looping. The i++ modifier is showing up as dead code.
Also, yes I know it doesn’t check the players inventory for the axe, I haven’t gotten that far.

	private static boolean goodAxe(final Client c) {
		for (int i = 0; i < VALID_AXE.length; i++) {
			if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == VALID_AXE[i]) {
				if (c.playerLevel[c.playerWoodcutting] >= AXE_REQS[i]) {
					return true;
				} else {
					c.sendMessage("You don't have the required level to cut with this axe!");
					return false;
				}
			} else {
				c.sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!");
				return false;
			}
		}
		return false;
	}

Read full topic
